name: Paracetamol
description: Used to treat fever and mild pain
warnings: Avoid alcohol, not suitable for liver disease patients.

name: Ibuprofen
usage: Used for pain relief, inflammation, and fever reduction.
sideEffects: Stomach pain, dizziness, kidney issues (if overdosed).
warnings: Avoid long-term use, take with food to prevent stomach upset.

name: Benadryl
usage: Soothes throat irritation and reduces coughing.
warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose, avoid alcohol.

name: Amoxicillin
usage: Treats bacterial infections like pneumonia and strep throat.
warnings: Complete full course, do not use for viral infections.

name: Cetirizine
description: Used for allergies and hay fever
usage: Relieves allergy symptoms such as sneezing and itching.
warnings: Avoid driving if drowsy, not for severe allergic reactions.

name: Aspirin
warnings: Avoid in children, take with food.

name: Metformin
usage: Controls blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes.
warnings: Monitor kidney function, take with food.

name: Omeprazole
usage: Treats acid reflux, ulcers, and heartburn.
warnings: Do not use long-term without medical advice.

name: Losartan
usage: Manages high blood pressure and heart conditions.
warnings: Monitor blood pressure regularly, avoid potassium supplements.

name: Azithromycin
usage: Treats bacterial infections like respiratory infections and STDs.
warnings: Complete the full course, avoid excessive sun exposure.

name: Dolo 650
usage: Used to relieve fever and mild to moderate pain.
warnings: Do not exceed 4 doses in 24 hours.

name: Ranitidine
description: Used for acid reflux and ulcers
usage: Reduces stomach acid and treats ulcers.

name: Atorvastatin
usage: Lowers cholesterol and reduces heart disease risk.
sideEffects: Muscle pain, liver issues, digestive problems.

name: Montelukast
description: Used to treat asthma and allergies
usage: Prevents asthma and relieves allergy symptoms.

name: Hydroxychloroquine
description: Used to treat malaria and arthritis
usage: Treats malaria, lupus, and rheumatoid arthritis.
warnings: Regular eye exams recommended, avoid overdose.
